DOC.brief_summary: This study aims at finding endophenotypes of schizophrenia at neuronal level by obtaining stem cells which is derived from adipose cells of subjects with heavy genetic loading for schizophrenia then differentiating them into neuronal cells.
DOC.brief_title: Stem Cell Research on Subjects at Genetic High Risk for Schizophrenia
DOC.criteria: [Subjects at genetic high risk for schizophrenia] Healthy without any Axis I mental disorder Is a monozygotic twin of a patient with schizophrenia OR Has at least two family members of schizophrenia in the pedigree, including at least one 1stdegree family member [Healthy Control] Healthy without any Axis I mental disorder No family members of schizophrenia in the pedigree to the 3rd degree Significant neurological or medical illness Psychotic symptoms Substance abuse Suicidal risk Blindness or hearing loss Taking aspirin, warfarin or hormonal agents Pregnancy or lactation Susceptibility for keloid formation Allergy to lidocaine History of significant head trauma or loss of consciousness Mental retardation
